channel.title: Angry Bear
channel.description: Relevant and even prescient commentary on news, politics and the economy.

item.title: Wages versus Product Markup
item.dc:creator: run75441
item.description:
Courtesy of EMicheal in comments. Kind of the point, I have been making for a while now. Labor wages are not the big driver of inflation. Corporations are increasing non-cost related prices and blaming it on inflation. But it’s not because of inflation. It is a cause of inflation. The public newscasters are selling their wares, ignorance, or lies […]

The post Wages versus Product Markup appeared first on Angry Bear.

item.dc:creator: NewDealdemocrat
item.description:
October jobs report: late cycle deceleration and deterioration  – by New Deal democrat With the sharp increases in interest rates, and the complete stalling of real consumer spending measured YoY, since early this year I have expected employment to follow suit, decelerating over time to a stall. And the three month average in employment gains […]

item.title: “Especially the Mail-In Ballots, that is Where the Big Issue Was”
item.dc:creator: run75441
item.description:
Are You Sure About that? Not sure why a man with an orange face and orangish thin hair holds such sway over so many people. He has done so little for the people who follow him. They believe his every word. In Arizona, the poll watchers are out at each of the polling boxes. Not […]

item.title: Africa, a biography
item.dc:creator: Joel Eissenberg
item.description:
Just finished “Africa, A Biography of a Continent”” by John Reader. I don’t recall how this book came into my possession. It may have been on my mom’s bookshelf when we stopped by after they moved to take whatever we wanted. Whatever its provenance, I had only read a little African history: “King Leopold’s Ghost” […]

The post Africa, a biography appeared first on Angry Bear.

item.description:

item.title: Endometriosis
item.dc:creator: Robert Waldmann
item.description:
endometriosis is a pain. Tissue like the lining of the uterus grows elsewhere, so that menstruation is not just unpleasant but extremely painful. As a reckless pretend expert on everything, I speculated that it happens because during menstruation some of the tissue (which is not just blood) doesn’t exit the vagina as it should but […]

The post Endometriosis appeared first on Angry Bear.

item.title: 21st century delights
item.dc:creator: Robert Waldmann
item.description:
I bought a bottle of Belgian beer here in Rome. The guy behind the counter guessed I was from the USA (might have been my Joementum t-shirt) and said something which I now understand was “want a glass”. I said huh and he said “hai bisogna di un bichiere” so I said no. On my […]

item.dc:creator: Daniel Becker
item.description:

As a marker of inflation and our personal economic experience all it shows is how terrible we are at remembering. Unfortunately […]

item.title: Putin’s war comes home
item.dc:creator: Angry Bear
item.description:
Infidel753, Putin’s war comes home. item.title: Originalism
item.dc:creator: Ken Melvin
item.description:
If one were to look in the U.S. Constitution for the meaning of ‘Originalism’, they wouldn’t find it. It’s not there. It wasn’t anywhere until the U.S. Supreme Court’s Brown vs Board of Education (1954). ‘Originalism’ originated with segregationists opposed to the decision. Since, it has been heard a lot from white supremacists, white southern […]

The post Originalism appeared first on Angry Bear.

item.title: What News Was in My In-Box

item.description:

Biden gives startlingly few interviews and news conferences. He doesn’t go for attention-grabbing stunts or high-engagement tweets. I am not always certain if this is strategy or necessity: It’s not obvious to […]
